class.name: IntBuffer2D

javadoc.text: Fixed sized (non resizable) streaming buffer connected to a target <tt>IntBuffer2DConsumer</tt> to which data is automatically flushed upon buffer overflow.
javadoc.author: wolfgang.hoschek@cern.ch

javadoc.text: Constructs and returns a new buffer with the given target.
javadoc.param: target the target to flush to.
capacity the number of points the buffer shall be capable of holding before overflowing and flushing to the target.

javadoc.text: Adds the specified point (x,y) to the receiver.
javadoc.param: x the x-coordinate of the point to add.
y the y-coordinate of the point to add.

javadoc.text: Adds all specified points (x,y) to the receiver.
javadoc.param: x the x-coordinates of the points to add.
y the y-coordinates of the points to add.

javadoc.text: Sets the receiver's size to zero. * In other words, forgets about any internally buffered elements.
Adds all internally buffered points to the receiver's target, then resets the current buffer size to zero.
